comments.content:
Only a guess, given the small sample—News Gothic:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/news-gothic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317184724/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/news-gothic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/news-gothic/")

The numbers in the lower right could be replicated with Bureau Grot:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/bureau-grot/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317184724/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/bureau-grot/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/bureau-grot/")
Concur with Kevin. Trade Gothic/News Gothic could do the job. Adding to his suggestions [Benton Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317184724/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/benton-sans).

Thanks. Thought it might be News Gothic, but wanted a second opinion because the text is so small.

Yeah, Bureau Grot is quite close for ‘2/6’.  
Are there any other fonts with such dramatic curve on ‘2’?

Other sans serifs with a dramatic |2|:  
 [http://optimo.ch/typefaces\_Theinhardt.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317184724/http:/optimo.ch/typefaces_Theinhardt.html "http://optimo.ch/typefaces\_Theinhardt.html")
